title: Direct Talk
subTitle: In 2025, Otani Akira's book The Night of Baba Yaga won the UK's prestigious Dagger prize for crime fiction in translation, a first for a Japanese author. She shares the inspiration behind her work.

title: IMPACTS:Climates Change the World
subTitle: Explores how rising temperatures driven by climate change have altered bee behaviour and led to declining populations, resulting in shortened pollination windows that threaten a global agricultural food crisis.

title: NHK World Japan
subTitle: At dusk in summer, a woman is absorbed in reading a letter. This chic lady is actually an advertisement model for Mitsui Echigoya, one of the top kimono fabric stores in Edo.

title: Medical Frontiers
subTitle: The crew explore efforts to preserve the anus using robotic-assisted surgery and artificial intelligence in patients with rectal cancer.

title: Our Blue Planet
subTitle: Explores the quest to safeguard the Earth's future through the life's work of two pioneering researchers dedicated to the formidable task of healing the natural world for those who follow.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Design X Stories
subTitle: Explores the profound links between nature and local craft, from the ever-changing Tottori Sand Dunes on the coast to the very heart of the region's design heritage.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Asia Insight
subTitle: Explores China's gender imbalance, which has seen men outnumber women and left those in rural villages struggling to find a spouse due to demands for assets.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Fighting Staff Shortages
subTitle: Explores the frontline of the Japanese hotel industry's recruitment efforts overseas as it seeks to address acute labour shortages amidst a record-breaking tourism boom.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Chatroom Japan
subTitle: Aditya Sharma seeks a sustainable balance between protecting the planet and meeting consumer demand for clothing. He explores a Japanese tradition in the hopes of finding inspiration.

title: Japan's Top Inventions
subTitle: Reporter Ishii Terumi explores the pioneering development of portable fetal monitors, gaining first-hand insights from the professionals.

title: Grand Sumo Highlights
subTitle: Sumo highlights from a range of tournaments that have taken place across the globe. Sumo is one of the most traditional Japanese sports and boasts a history going back more than 1500 years.

title: Sumopedia
subTitle: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Through the Winds of 100 Years
subTitle: The crew meet Mahathir Mohamad, Malaysia's most enduring leader, as he reaches his centenary. Having spent a lifetime challenging ethnic friction, colonial-era imbalance, and global pressures, he reflects on the legacy he now wishes to leave behind.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: IMPACTS: On the Brink of Extinction? Special Edition
subTitle: Explores the accelerating threat of a sixth mass extinction driven by human-induced climate change, examining how lessons from the past can inform the urgent actions needed.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Cycle Around Japan
subTitle: While beautiful Aomori can be harsh due to its northern climate, a visiting cyclist enjoys the warmest of welcomes in communities that historically had to cooperate closely in everything in order to survive.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Design X Stories
subTitle: Explores the profound links between nature and local craft, from the ever-changing Tottori Sand Dunes on the coast to the very heart of the region's design heritage.

title: Design Ah! neo
subTitle: As different colours, blue and yellow can make green by getting together, similarly different lives can coexist by helping each other.

title: Mitateru-Phose: Let's Change Perspective!
subTitle: Using *mitateru*, a Japanese method, to stimulate children's imaginative thinking by prompting them to perceive objects in unconventional ways, fostering their individual viewpoints and inventiveness.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Magical Japanese
subTitle: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. A look at the unique world of the Japanese language, accompanied with scenes from Japan.

title: The Seasons of Yamato
subTitle: A series of poetic videos by Koichi Hozan, a videographer living in Nara, in collaboration with a pianist, Mine Kawakami, for which she plays exclusive pieces, representing each season.

title: NHK World Japan
subTitle: A look at the rich and fascinating Edo era of Japan, which was dominated by a deep love for the arts. The traditional woodblock prints called Ukiyo-e blossomed during this period of time.

title: Grand Sumo Highlights
subTitle: Sumo highlights from a range of tournaments that have taken place across the globe. Sumo is one of the most traditional Japanese sports and boasts a history going back more than 1500 years.

title: Magical Japanese
subTitle: Explores how the Japanese people's deep connection with nature is reflected in their language through various idioms and expressions related to kusa, or grass.

title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
subTitle: Gojinjo Taiko is a wild, powerful performance by masked drummers. It originated 400 years ago, when villagers disguised themselves as `oni', AKA, demons, to scare away a warlord's army.

title: Sumopedia
subTitle: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Tiny Desk Concerts Japan
subTitle: QUBIT, a five-piece band has been celebrated for their innovative sound. They bring their signature electronic sound to NHK's Shibuya office, exciting the audience with a dynamic and organic experimental performance.

title: BOSAI: Science That Can Save Your Life
subTitle: Japan faces threats from a range of natural disasters including flooding, tsunamis and volcanic eruptions. Explores research underway to help detect and reduce the impact of natural disasters.

title: Design Museum Japan
subTitle: Takeya Takayuki, a model maker, learns about the uniquely carved and decorated fishing boats used in the herring industry before the 1950s.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: J-MELO
subTitle: Experience the cutting edge of Japanese entertainment as we turn the spotlight on virtual artists. This week, the all-male VTuber group HOLOSTARS.

title: Little Charo
subTitle: The adventures of Charo, a Japanese dog who finds himself lost in New York City and decides to find his way back home.

title: Japanology Plus Mini
subTitle: In Japan, sweet potatoes are often baked or turned into sweets. But they can also be used to generate electricity or protect from heat. Introducing the diverse ways in which they are used and sold.

title: A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
subTitle: Kotaro likes to go for walks near the mausoleum for Date Masamune, a famous historical lord. Komimi, who lives in a glass workshop, has a surprising spot where she likes to drink water.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: The World Heritage
subTitle: Explores important landmarks and cultural heritage sites of the world with spectacular views.

title: Time-Lapse Japan
subTitle: Shimizu Daisuke investigates various aspects of Japanese culture and traditions using the technique of time-lapse photography.

subTitle: Sumo highlights from a range of tournaments that have taken place across the globe. Sumo is one of the most traditional Japanese sports and boasts a history going back more than 1500 years.

subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Ramen Japan
subTitle: Explores Okayama's popular tonkotsu ramen, featuring a classic pork cutlet topping and a fragrant bowl of chicken broth.

title: Core Kyoto Mini
subTitle: Filled with noble, graceful dignity, Kyoto dolls have long embodied people's prayers, relieved loneliness, and represented prayers for their children's growth. A look at the Hina dolls that reflect adoration for nobility.

title: Easy Japanese for Work
subTitle: Tran Van Vuong from Vietnam who works as a fishing rod designer tends to use daijoobu, instead of yoroshii. By role-playing, he'll learn how to ask for permission.

title: Zero Waste Life
subTitle: Judo instructor Sato Hitoe uses worn-out uniforms, or gis, to make items like tote bags. Very durable, since the original material was meant to be tough. And behind it all is Sato's love for judo.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Quantum Entanglement
subTitle: Is quantum entanglement real, or just a misunderstanding? The question confounded Einstein and ruined the lives of many physicists. Follow the story of the 100-year mystery that changed physics.

subTitle: Explores the history of the Murakami Kaizoku, sailors and fighters in the Seto Inland Sea, with footage of the Kurushima Straits.

title: Activate Your Japanese
subTitle: Time has passed and the hotel's autumn campaign has been a success. Rei tells Xuan that he is quitting his job at the hotel to go to France. Unable to process this sudden revelation, Xuan shrinks from talking to Rei even on the day of his departure.

subTitle: Comprised of several regular programs with the theme of creating a multicultural society. Answering questions about Japan from foreign viewers, looking at international exchange programs, and giving tips on disaster preparedness.

subTitle: Explores various aspects of Hokkaido, ranging from the ecology of brown bears and the craftsmanship of a bespoke bento to a landscape uniquely shaped by the region's rugged natural conditions and pioneering history.

title: Direct Talk
subTitle: Umemoto Ayaka is captain of the Japan women's national deaf volleyball team. She and her teammates, who include her twin sister Sayaka, are aiming for the gold at the 2025 Tokyo Deaflympics.

title: Japan Delish
subTitle: Ever heard of an-pan?! From fruit sandwiches to curry-filled delights, Japanese bread is full of delicious surprises!

title: Japan Delish
subTitle: Japan's longest-loved noodle dish, udon. Savour its undeniable appeal through local favourites and cutting-edge creations!

title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Bustling Scenes of Old Tokyo
subTitle: Explores the famous painting of white plum blossoms that captivated Van Gogh, revealing how the specific tree at Kameido Umeyashiki was identified.

subTitle: Time has passed and the hotel's autumn campaign has been a success. Rei tells Xuan that he is quitting his job at the hotel to go to France. Unable to process this sudden revelation, Xuan shrinks from talking to Rei even on the day of his departure.

title: Culture Crossroads
subTitle: Comprised of several regular programs with the theme of creating a multicultural society. Answering questions about Japan from foreign viewers, looking at international exchange programs, and giving tips on disaster preparedness.

title: Hello! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
subTitle: Explores various aspects of Hokkaido, ranging from the ecology of brown bears and the craftsmanship of a bespoke bento to a landscape uniquely shaped by the region's rugged natural conditions and pioneering history.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Seasoning the Seasons
subTitle: Takes a look at Noboribetsu, a spa resort in Hokkaido where has been in business since 1858 and features five different types of hot springs.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Medical Frontiers
subTitle: Prevention to cure, the groundbreaking world of Japanese medical technology and healthcare, from food and exercise to the latest treatments.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Where We Call Home
subTitle: The crew meet Chris Hinds, an American ensuring the safe conduct of Nagano's Nozawa Onsen fire festival, and Andrew Mancabelli, an American crafting Japanese armour in Warabi.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Grand Sumo Highlights
subTitle: Sumo highlights from a range of tournaments that have taken place across the globe. Sumo is one of the most traditional Japanese sports and boasts a history going back more than 1500 years.

title: Sumopedia
subTitle: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Activate Your Japanese
subTitle: Time has passed and the hotel's autumn campaign has been a success. Rei tells Xuan that he is quitting his job at the hotel to go to France. Unable to process this sudden revelation, Xuan shrinks from talking to Rei even on the day of his departure.

title: Culture Crossroads
subTitle: Comprised of several regular programs with the theme of creating a multicultural society. Answering questions about Japan from foreign viewers, looking at international exchange programs, and giving tips on disaster preparedness.

title: Hello! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
subTitle: Explores various aspects of Hokkaido, ranging from the ecology of brown bears and the craftsmanship of a bespoke bento to a landscape uniquely shaped by the region's rugged natural conditions and pioneering history.

title: Newsroom Tokyo
subTitle: Comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia. It explains the day's developments and what is behind them.

title: Direct Talk
subTitle: Umemoto Ayaka is captain of the Japan women's national deaf volleyball team. She and her teammates, who include her twin sister Sayaka, are aiming for the gold at the 2025 Tokyo Deaflympics.
